reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The way Isekai were ment to be
reviews.reviewText: Most Isekai fall into this trope of some shut in gamer who's only life is the MMO RPG they obsesse over, then they miraculously find themselves in the body of their over powered character. And typically the knowledge of the game they have actually applies to the real world. So all the hours they spent gaming actually means something now. Then typically they spend their time either making a harem and/or trying to recreate, things they liked about, Japan in this new world. That is 98% of all Isekai. This book however has none of that. A group of people find themselves in this strange new fantasy world and don't remember anything about where they came from or themselves. The only thing they know is their name.This story had excellent character development. It's a fantasy story about how a group of outcast strangers must band together to be able to survive in this new world that they have found themselves in. Yes there is magic and yes there's game like mechanics mentioned, but it honestly feels more like a fantasy story than your typical Isekai.I watched the anime based off this series first before reading the book. I loved the anime and wanted to know more of the story. I was not disappointed in this book as it follows closely along with the anime. By the end of the book it's still not covered everything in season 1.Great book, I can't wait to start the next one. I'd recommend this book to anyone who is an Isekai fan but wants to read something different.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Tal cual se describe, es un poco más grueso de lo que pensé. Me encantó el anime y necesitaba desesperadamente continuar con la historia así que revivirla desde el tomo uno era mandatario.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good if a little slow…
reviews.reviewText: So I’m here because of the anime. If you’re like me you’re here because you want more of the story… That being said the pacing in the novel is vastly different from the pacing in the anime. Major plot points happen while the world is being built. It makes it hard to get invested in the characters other than Manato and Hauhiro. This book is far from bad or even the worse light novel I’ve read. It’s just not the best either. Still a good read and I recommend it in case you want to know more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It starts slowly and it is confusing to follow track of the conversations and characters at the begining, but it gets better and better each page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This book is packed full with story. There is almost no fillers throughout the whole book. Not only that but out of all of the isekai books I read this one feels the most real. There is one complaint I have of how so many characters stumble over their words/ aren't very confident. That complaint brings more realism into the book as you get used to it and made me feel more invested as I saw the characters grow. A truly amazing book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! An Isekai that can draw you in! More please!
reviews.reviewText: I have now read multitudes of isekai light novels and watched their animes. I've tried out things from the vastly popular, to the niche and obscure, to the amateur. I often mention that I do not believe there is such thing as an original story or idea. There is but one story, and we just live it and tell it from different perspectives, and that is where creativity dwells. Grimgar goes well beyond refreshing and satisfying for me, it is outright fulfilling and highly praiseworthy. Thank you for writing this, I can't wait to read more. It is wonderful to have a story that actually communicates a very human experience. It is thrilling to have a story about the fantastical that explores things other than cheap thrills found in adolescent fantasies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I watched the anime a few years ago, and when I heard there was a full series of novels, I knew I had to read them and finish the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars How did we get here? What are we doing?
reviews.reviewText: The main characters find themselves asking these questions and more, yet are unable to find answers to these questions. Instead, they have a hazy feeling about events leading up to the day they woke up in complete darkness in the bottom of a tower located in a strange land. They know it to be strange place, yet they struggle to remember more than their names.Now they are told they have to fight. There is not much of an alternate in the way of options. This new world is kill or be killed. Follow the underdogs on thier journey through this world called Grimgar.Having watched the anime, I am excited to see how this story will flesh out and compare to the main plot points covered in the show. Overall it was an enjoyable read with a few touching scenes. Volume 1 ends on a great note and I'm more than ready to jump right into volume 2.
Ví el anime y es mí favorito de fantasía. La novela también es muy buena, continuaré leyendo los siguientes tomos.

After watching the anime many years ago I put off reading this and I have to say it didn't disappoint. Only complaint is the sad parts didn't hit as hard as the anime. I really liked the inner dialogue

La novela la comencé, supongo que como muchos otros, por haber visto el anime. A nivel argumental, es mi saga favorita de novela ligera. Además, es lo que de verdad pasaría si a nosotros, los lectores, nos mandaran en formato Isekai.Tiene un estilo de escritura que a mí se me hace ligero, y no es vocabulario especialmente complicado. Eso sí, no es un libro de niños... trata temas algo más serios y crudos, aunque lo haga con humor y fantasía a veces.Esta primera novela cubre la primera mitad de la temporada, y además incluye más datos y nuevas perspectivas que en el anime se saltan... como por ejemplo, que empiezan todos en unas circunstancias aún más patéticas que como nos muestra en la animación. Además, Ranta es tan frustrante o incluso más que en el anime... está increíblemente bien adaptado todo.Como contra (aunque a mi no me afecta), es que sólo está disponible en inglés.

reviews.reviewTitle: A strong Novel and easy to understand
reviews.reviewText: Before reading the Novel i have watched the Anime alot of Times. I was impressed how the Anime caught details and characters from the novel so exact. Since there is no second season of the Anime yet i wanted to know how the story continues and the novel did his job better then i thought.

Não sei como a editora e o vendedor fazem isso, mas a qualidade dessa novel é simplismente a melhor que já vi, além disso a entrega foi bem rapida. Agora partido pra questão do inglês, sou brasileiro e consegui ler perfeitamente esse volume, a escrita do autor é limpa e impecavel, facil de entender e raramente tem alguma ambiguidade, pra alguém que quer começar a ler em inglês essa é uma otima escolha, agora para alguém que já possui a habilidade de ler em inglês esse volume ainda é uma boa escolha, a historia é bem desenvolvida e complexa, mas não o bastante para te confundir, todos os conceitos são apresentados aos poucos, o narrador personagem também não estrapola nos pensamentos (algo comum em novels), não tenho reclamações sobre essa maravilha da literatura
